logline: An anxious product manager peers over malfunctioning AI diagnostics, grappling with the fragile line between reliance and skepticism.
scene: Set inside a dimly lit control room, walls are lined with flickering screens displaying various AI outputs, some green-lit with confidence scores, others flashing amber warnings. The product manager, a middle-aged woman in a rumpled shirt, stands hunched over a table cluttered with reports and data monitors. Her eyes dart nervously between a screen showing a high-stakes prediction failure and a nearby console where a bright red alert pinging indicates an AI error just occurred during a critical client meeting. Tension fills the air as she contemplates whether to trust the AI's next suggestion or dig deeper for manual verification.
keyProps: flickering screens with various confidence ratings
paper reports overflowing with scribbles and annotations
a bright red alert light indicating an AI error
an old-fashioned calculator juxtaposed against modern tech
cold cups of coffee to highlight the long hours
camera: A tight shot capturing the product manager's furrowed brow, slowly zooming out to reveal the chaotic state of the control room.
lighting: Low, harsh overhead lights mixed with the soft glow of the monitors, creating a stark contrast between the hope of AI predictions and the dread of unseen errors.
